title: Business Analyst || Life Insurance || International Market Exposure(Immediate Joiners)
description:
Position Title: Business Analyst || Life Insurance || International Market Exposure(Immediate Joiners)

Experience Level: 6+ Years

Location: Remote




Expected Skills/ Competency/JD

Good knowledge on Policy Administration system for Individual Life, Annuities and Group Life.
Knowledge and hands on experience in Quotation & Illustrations, Agency management and Commissions, Accounting, Portals, Reinsurance.
Actively participate in requirement gathering, gap analysis, and feasibility study, prepare functional requirement/Design document, coordination and walk thru with developers/business users, testing and implementing the changes in the system.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to clearly and concisely present requirements.
Review delivered solutions for quality and accuracy.




Must have Skill set

Strong understanding of policy administration processes and systems specific to Individual Life, Annuities, and Group Life Insurance.
Proficiency in navigating, configuring, and managing policy lifecycle events such as issuance, servicing, renewals, and cancellations.
Practical experience in Quotation and Illustration generation to support life and annuity policy proposals.
Solid knowledge of Agency Management and Commissions processes, including agent onboarding, commission structures, and payout calculations.
Strong skills in eliciting and documenting requirements through workshops, stakeholder interviews, and documentation review.
Ability to conduct gap analysis to identify areas of improvement and feasibility studies to assess the impact and practicality of proposed changes.
Proficiency in creating Functional Requirement Specifications (FRS) and Design Documents to clearly outline system capabilities and solutions.
Demonstrated experience in facilitating requirement walkthroughs and design discussions with both technical and business stakeholders.
Effective collaboration with developers and QA teams to ensure accurate implementation and testing of system changes.
Skilled in coordinating and communicating with business users to ensure alignment on requirements and expected outcomes.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively translate technical and business requirements for various audiences.
Skilled in producing clear and comprehensive documentation including requirements, functional specifications, and user guides.




Good to have Skill set

Familiarity with regulatory standards like HIPAA, GDPR, and IFRS17, especially as they pertain to life insurance, annuities, and group life.
Knowledge of state-specific regulations for insurance and compliance considerations for policy administration.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Kanban) and experience in tools like JIRA, Confluence, or Azure DevOps for project tracking and collaboration.
Understanding of product lifecycle management for designing, launching, and maintaining new insurance products, including experience with product configuration tools.
Strong stakeholder engagement skills to effectively collaborate with diverse teams, including business users, developers, and executives.
Proficiency in conflict resolution techniques to handle competing priorities or differing requirements.
